list_definition.definition: the act of working too hard

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: It’s overwork that made him ill.

list_ex_of_english: Everyone is overworked in this business.
I have never observed restrictive practices operating to prevent married women overworking.
The officials are very much overworked; one has only to see them in one's own local district to know that.
When tenure isn't enough: overworked and unhappy, a tenured professor decides she wants out.
Apart from "dynamism"the words"belief", "hope", "faith"and"conviction" have been overworked in the debate.
In these days, when both dentists and doctors are considerably overworked, it is action like this which would ease their lot.
All this adds an extra load on to the backs of people who are already overworked.
The list of words overworked or misused - and not by students alone - is inexhaustible.
